Sentencas: Yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) is a well-studied and practically applied electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC), but the high sintering temperature causes some problems.
Titulo: Cold sintering process assisted sintering for 8YSZ ceramic: A way of achieving high density and electrical conductivity at a reduced sintering temperature

Sentencas: In this work, 8 mol% yttria-stabilized zirconia (8YSZ) ceramics were prepared by a cold sintering process (CSP) technique associated with post-heat-treatment (PHT).
Titulo: Cold sintering process assisted sintering for 8YSZ ceramic: A way of achieving high density and electrical conductivity at a reduced sintering temperature

Sentencas: The CSP was beneficial for getting high initial density for the green bulk, while the PHT could further improve the bulk density of the 8YSZ ceramics at a reduced sintering temperature.
Titulo: Cold sintering process assisted sintering for 8YSZ ceramic: A way of achieving high density and electrical conductivity at a reduced sintering temperature

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectra showed that the electrical conductivity was 0.060 S/cm at 850 degrees C for the 8YSZ ceramic prepared by CSPPHT at 1300 degrees C, about twice of that prepared by CS.
Titulo: Cold sintering process assisted sintering for 8YSZ ceramic: A way of achieving high density and electrical conductivity at a reduced sintering temperature

Sentencas: The improved electrical conductivity was attributed to the high density and the reduced activation energy relevant to refined grain size and increased bulk density.
Titulo: Cold sintering process assisted sintering for 8YSZ ceramic: A way of achieving high density and electrical conductivity at a reduced sintering temperature

Sentencas: Our study demonstrates that the CSP-PHT is a promising technique for preparation of high-dense YSZ ceramics with improved electrical conductivity at a reduced sintering temperature.
Titulo: Cold sintering process assisted sintering for 8YSZ ceramic: A way of achieving high density and electrical conductivity at a reduced sintering temperature
